subject: Economics
title: Mercantilism: The Zero-Sum Trade Fallacy
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Mercantilism: The Zero-Sum Trade Fallacy.

hook.text: For 300 years, European empires believed trade was zero-sum: my gain is your loss.

buildup.text: Mercantilism: wealth = gold. Export everything, import nothing, accumulate treasure.

discovery.text: Nations banned imports, subsidized exports, and fought wars to control trade routes â€” all to ensure gold flowed inward.

twist.text: Adam Smith demolished mercantilism in 1776: trade isn't zero-sum. Both sides benefit from voluntary exchange.

climax.text: Mercantilism is officially dead. But its logic â€” protect our industries, punish their exports.

punchline.text: The idea that trade has losers was disproven 250 years ago.

quiz.question: What was the fundamental error of mercantilist thinking?
options: It assumed trade was zero-sum, when in fact voluntary trade can benefit both sides
